Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: HappyTrailsBoston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kona Kai in a third floor room, king bed, balcony with marina view. I would rate the hotel average+ largely due to it's beautiful location on Shelter Island. The room was ok, clean, but somewhat dated. Free wifi was nice. Outdoor heated Pool is large with some lap lanes and a nice spa. There is a sand "sunning" beach with playground equipment, nice for children. You can walk or run on a path along the water's edge. We had breakfast once at the hotel restaurant. Background music is Hawaiian and very pleasant. Food and service were good but there were not many diners so it's hard to say what it would be like when busier. The parking lot for guests is gated, requiring a room key swipe to open gate when entering and exiting. The device at the exit gate must have been hit by a vehicle because it is bent lower than a car window, and difficult to swipe. It should be repaired.

Reviews.Title: “JUST WHAT I NEEDED”
Reviews.Author: Irma_T60750
Reviews.Content: To celebrate my birthday March 16 (news predicting a terrible cold front), and to brighten the occassion, I invited my husband to join me at the Kona Kai to celebrate my 62nd Birthday. The hotel is beautiful and Tina thereceptionist at the front desk greeted me with "Mahalo" and I knew I had made the perfect choice to go to the Kona Kai Hotel The room faced the pool and jacuzzi and a lovely sight of boats. In celebration of my birthday, Tina gave me 2 drinks (maitai's) on the house and breakfast for the morning. Although it was raining in the morning, were able to see the Regata races(beautiful sailing boats (all sizes and shapes) with people having a great time. Thank you Tina and all the staff at the Kona Kai for making this occasion special.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: aggiedoone
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night when the airline canceled my flight and arranged a room at this hotel for the night. The room showed lots of wear and tear and the decor is outdated. The internet was free but the connection was very bad. The telephone in my room did not work. However, the staff was very nice and helpful and called me a cab the next morning to get back to the airport. I would not stay here with my own money, but it might be ok if you get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: drpepper7
Reviews.Content: The only thing good about this hotel is the location ...besides which 1) Internet sucks - I was at a meeting with a big group of scientists and not a single person was able to connect to the internet 2) Hallways are smelly 3) Rooms are small and beds sack 4) They charge even for the gym and parking... I am going to advise my or any other group to stay away and not return.

Reviews.Title: “A great time in San Diego & Kona Kai Resort”
Reviews.Author: milo w
Reviews.Content: A beautiful location for a great three day tour in and around San Diego. The lobby was beautiful with a fireplace, comfortable seating areas and nice views of the bay. We took another couple with us and had rooms on the west end of the second floor with balconies looking out over the harbor. It included free gated parking and breakfasts. The resort personnel were friendly and responsive.(Tina & Andrea) The resort is not new and shows a little wear of time, but it was clean and neat. The maintainance man was at our room within a couple of minutes to fix a small problem. They set us up with a great sightseeing tour of Old Town, Balboa Park, San Diego Zoo, Little Italy, Coronado Island and the Gaslamp Quarter. The breakfasts in the beautiful dining room were very good. The waiters (Francisco and Jesus) were attentive and good. The pool and hot tub were enjoyable after a great day of sightseeing. We will return with other friends.

Reviews.Title: “Sea World trip with the kids.”
Reviews.Author: Sonjah D
Reviews.Content: Hotel was beautiful! Our room was perfect. The grounds were well maintained. Internet was quick. We ate breakfast and dinner there. The dining room was nice, the food was delicious though a little pricey. The service was kind of slow but isn't that the way things are on the island. We had no problems with anything. It was a fast and easy drive to Sea World from the hotel. We will certainly stay here again when we come back to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “What a shame!”
Reviews.Author: Vineman707
Reviews.Content: For the rate of $159 a night I was not expecting the Four Seasons. That being said it is a shame that the owners of this hotel can not keep up on the maintenance. We were in a second floor room at the very west end of the hotel. The building have mold and dirt on them everywhere. Just a pressure washing would help but a paint job is in order. We also had somebodies room servcie left overs out in the hall for two days! The location is fantastic, expecially for dog owners. The breakfast was very nice and the pool and spa looked good. I do not think it is too much to ask to keep a hotel clean on the outside? The interior of our room was clean but VERY dated.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location”
Reviews.Author: missingthebuffet
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely view of the bay out front and a view of the marina while eating breakfast. We got the "Island Getaway Deal" so we paid $118.30/night and it included breakfast and parking, heck of a deal. The room was abit outdated but it was doable since we were only there to sleep, lots of closet space, it was quiet and we had a good sleep. The breakfast was delicious, we had the vegetable fritatta. The location was perfect to get to Sea World, The Zoo, drive along the harbour, ocean beach park, etc. We ate at Pizza Nova one night and loved it. Nice atmosphere, nice marina out front and delicious food, not just pizza. I also recommend going to La Jolla and checking out Torrey Pines scenic drive to the glideport where you can watch people hang gliding or flying other planes.

Reviews.Title: “It was relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette4681
Reviews.Content: Nice place very relaxing n romantic not much to do but very relaxing n thats what we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Outside, Tired and Worn Out Room”
Reviews.Author: 84fiero
Reviews.Content: My one night stay here was average at best. The location on Shelter Island is great. The grounds and common areas were well done and the front desk staff were friendly and helpful. However the room left a lot to be desired. It had a scent of hospital disinfectant mixed with cigarette smoke from years ago. Stained curtains and sheers, worn out carpet. The desk chair had noticeable stains on the fabric and with only two table lamps in the entire room, it was dark and depressing - no light enough to read or do work. The standalone cabinet in the bathroom was so worn the paint was coming off and corners were rounded down, it looked to be about 25 years old. The grout in the shower was dingy and the bathroom probably has never been remodeled. The HVAC system consisted of a very old in-wall unit with tiny knobs that were located at floor level - odd, considering this was supposed to be an accessible room. It did a poor job of maintaining a good temperature. Had I been paying out of my own pocket, I would've left after seeing the room, to be honest. I've stayed at nicer Red Roof Inns. I almost hesitated to write this, as I feel like one of the overly-picky reviews that I hate. I normally don't care if things are a little older, etc but this just felt dirty and not maintained. And in 2012 I'd expect decent lighting and a workable HVAC system at the very least.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place!”
Reviews.Author: Anita L
Reviews.Content: I wasn't looking for a luxury stay while in San Diego, just an affordable one. I travel with cats so when I first tried to book online via one of the 'discount hotel' websites, I realized I better call the actual place and find out if the cats would be ok. While inquiring, I spoke with Jessica at the Kona Kai who not only said 'sure, the cats are fine as long as we know ahead of time' but also informed me that she could get me a much better rate than the one I was about to purchase. Of course I booked the room! When I showed up, I was delighted to find it located across the bay from downtown and to find the views spectacular on either side of the place! For less than I would have paid for little more than a bed sized room downtown, I got this beautiful spacious room complete with a balcony overlooking the beautiful harbor at Shelter Island! The breakfast tickets were a plus as well! Real, sit down breakfast each day, with a decent selection to pick from and add on items available as well. I am an avid cyclist and was thrilled to find such great road biking on the island and to find it just a few short scenic miles to get to the downtown area or a few hilly, challenging miles to get to Ocean Beach! My legs are grateful for the location of this place! Jessica and everyone else I encountered at the resort were wonderful to work with, very helpful, and I never had a bad encounter with any of them. In fact, I ended up extending my stay because I loved it there so much!

Reviews.Title: “Just another hotel by the water”
Reviews.Author: hrza04a
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for three nights in February. The hotel is located at the end of Shelter Island, across the street from the San Diego Bay waterfront and a sidewalk / jogging path. The back of the hotel abuts a marina. Parking ($15 a night fee) is between the hotel and the street, and note that the outdoor seating area for many of the standard rooms face the parking lot. The grounds and plantings were well maintained. Check-in was efficient and the room easy to find. Fortunately, our standard room was in the last building in the complex with a small outdoor seating area overlooking a grassy area, not the parking lot. Although there were a few nice touches, such as a tiled sink area, the room was fairly typical - did not stand out positively or negatively. Carpeting and furnishings were in good shape, although some of the wallpaper in the bathroom was beginning to peel. King bed was comfortable, but not very substantial so that any movement on the bed caused it to shake. The room had a mini-fridge but no coffee maker (a cup of coffee in the restaurant to go was $3). Free wifi worked well. Use of hotel gym was $10/day per person (better off driving 10 minutes to a real gym and spending $15). There was a small 'beach' area facing the marina on the back side of the property, but even if you could swim there, you wouldn't want to with such close proximity to boats and related pollution. If you want to swim in the bay, there is a public beach about a 10 minute walk away. The property does have a nice heated swimming pool with plenty of chaise lounges. Staff was courteous and helpful. When we reported a burnt out lightbulb and squeaky door, they were fixed the same day. In short, the Kona Kai is just another hotel by the water. Not a resort and not a lot of charm, but not a bad place to stay if you can get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Ahoy sailors!”
Reviews.Author: Crest25
Reviews.Content: As the Reunion Chairman for the USS Will Rogers Veterans Association, a Navy submarine crew from the Cold War era, our stay was wonderful. It began with proper planning with helpful reservation staff. This included estimates on number of rooms, banquet facilities, entertainment, activities, transportation, limited mobility considerations, etc. I never heard one employee use the word "no" or "I'm sorry." Our wishes were carried out and with a smile. The scenery was magnificent with view of wonderful boats next to their private beach to the East and harbor view to the West side even including across the harbor to the Submarine Base and Coronado (North Island). While our visit was one of a reunion for a bunch of submarine sailors, I would stay at the Kona Kai if it were just my own family. It is close to everything you could want within a 15-minute drive or less. Try it; you'll like it. Tell 'em Ed sent you.

Reviews.Title: “Hi front desk.. I think there is a ghost in our room..”
Reviews.Author: EmeraldBird
Reviews.Content: Our room in the main building right above front lobby had an extra guest. The lights had a mind of their own, tv wanted to change channels & the dark swirling shadow couldn't be explained away. After 10 hours on the road we just wanted to go to sleep. Late check in found us with a grumpy front desk agent (it was only 10:30pm) a very average room (we are returning, local guests & booked a premium room) not the same layout, view, decor or design of the room we had stayed in during a past visit. Check out found some confusion about parked vehicles, were told parking would be complementary, then charged for two cars in a near empty lot. We chose to not move rooms as it was very late. We unplugged everything and that seemed to take care of the electrical "issues" lovely hotel, nice location.. rooms on the far side of the pool overlooking the luau area are far superior to rooms in the main building.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, as long as you don't expect this to be an actual resort!”
Reviews.Author: KATIEPIXIEDUST
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for our anniversary. One thing I can say is that they do have wonderful views, one side is full of interesting yacts, and the other side has a nice view of the open water. At first my bf was really irritated that there were a million college kids, but they didn't make much noise & he eventually forgot about them. Our room was okay. Nothing special, except that you could hear some type of seal or sea lion from our balcony (which some people might find annoying but we happened to enjoy). They had a nice gym & bike rental area, and it was very relaxing to just stroll around the hotel, since it's right on the sand. The best part of the hotel, in our opinion, was the restaurant. We are the quiet type, so we were delighted to have dinner mostly to ourselves at the beautiful restraunt with the ocean view. We also got a free breakfast that was included in our stay in the morning (there was only a few other people that time as well). The food was great and the venue was high class. It was pretty difficult to find our room at first, but the actual hotel, which is three stories, isn't that big. It seemed like there was some interesting places to eat down the street too. I would say, if you get a good deal on the room (no more than $100), and you live within an hour or two of SD, go for a night and enjoy yourself! More than one night is probably too much though.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you are a sailor, otherwise look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: travlinman36
Reviews.Content: Long ago, in a very different life, I spent 2 glorious years aboard the USS Will Rogers, the ultimate Polaris submarine. It was in service from late 1966 [my era] to the early 1980s [it is now razor blades]. Last October a number of its alumni gathered in San Diego. We convened at the Kona Kai. From the point of view of the reunion the KK has it all: plenty of rooms at a reasonable price, great location with a view of the Submarine Base, meeting rooms, restaurants, and is close to the airport. From the point of view of the individual guest, the KK has seen better days. Specifically, the carpet of the first room to which I was assigned was soaking wet, sopping wet. Upon notifying the front desk of the problem we were immediately moved to a similar room with a dry carpet. The rest of the room was just fine. Comfortable beds, good shower, plenty of space, nice balcony with view of the marina. But, the entire property shows its age. And the restaurant is mediocre and pricey. The Kona Kai was fine for our purpose, but I would not go out of my way to stay there again. Worse yet, parking is NOT free.

Reviews.Title: “Aggravating service”
Reviews.Author: puppyvet
Reviews.Content: We had a room reserved and prepaid fr two nights to get some rest after a road trip with two young children before returning home on an early flight. When we arrived NewYears eve at 7 pm we were told there was no room for us and we were sent to a differrent hotel for the night, but would have to return to KonaKai the following night. There was no early check in, so after being kicked out of the other hotel and after packing our many bags and infant crib we had no room for the rest of the day. The receptionist at Kona Kai did not give us a call to tell us our room was now available, but asked us to check back every hour or so. When we finally got our room at 5 pm we resettled into the new room and were offered free breakfast for the next morning which we could not use because of early departure. Dinner was declined by the manager, microwave rental was 10 Dollars (which they waived after some dicussion) and there was zero sympathy for our situation except for the standard " I am sorry" . The management's ignorance cost us a day of vacation, and it is extremely hard to understand why a hotel would treat their guests like this.

Reviews.Title: “Some Great, Some not so much...”
Reviews.Author: Tomincolorado
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kona Kai 3 nights, the 25th - 27th the first night, Christmas night, we checked in at 1:30 am. We were very tired and just wanted a bed. We found the room, which was ok but we had no heat, the heat exchanger was not working. The room was about 60 degrees but we were to tired to change rooms so we piled the blankets from both beds on to one and had a cozy night. The next morning we awoke to a beautiful view in a chilly room. We let the manager know and they took care of the problem with the heater. The Hotel its self is a little rough around the edges and could use a face left. We ate in the dinning room for breakfast all three days and found the food to be very tasty, maybe a little pricey. The location of the hotel is to die for, very close to the airport, close to everything worth seeing and right on the water. There are great walks right outside the door, the views are fantastic and the price is a value. We paid $83.50 per night for a standard room with two queen beds, parking was extra and the price did not include breakfast, the internet services were free and fast. However, because of our problem the first night the manager comped the room for that night and also gave us free parking, no arguing, no hassle. If your looking for an upscale hotel with all the bells and whistles, this is not it. If your looking for a nice hotel at a great value, give the Kona Kai Resort a try.

Reviews.Title: “"The grand old lady is showing her age"”
Reviews.Author: apacheap
Reviews.Content: I grew up in San Diego and in the 60's and 70's this hotel was the place to stay. Now the hotel is showing it's age and is in need of major rennovations, especially in the rooms. We still found the rooms clean and the staff pleasant and courteous and you cannot beat the location for beautiful views of San Diego and the harbor. Our room rate was so deeply discounted it proved to me they were desperate to get guests. There was also nobody in the restaurant the night we stayed at the property. Still, until some money is put back into this place- the ratings will continue to be just average.

Reviews.Title: “OK but Not Great”
Reviews.Author: Gwenbry
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a meeting in San Diego. While the staff were friendly, the room I stayed in was dated. I had to unplug the clock in order to have an outlet to recharge my phone or plug in my laptop, and the air conditioner kept tripping the electrical circuit box. I had three great nights of sleep, and then on the last night the fire alarm went off at 4 am and continued to go on off for another hour and a half. No apologies or explanations were provided when I checked out that morning, and needless to say, I left feeling very tired. Although the price was OK for a large metropolitan area, I cannot give this hotel a good recommendation, and I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “1st Time Was Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: Future1investor
Reviews.Content: My first time to San Diego and to the Kona Kai Resort formerly known as I think: Shelter Point Hotel & Marina. It has two sides: Marina or Bay. I think the second floor overlooking the Marina is the nicest but some may prefer the bay view. You should know that this is an older property and may not be up to your liking though they seem to want to please. Don't use the concierge service as they are more expensive than finding things on your own like rental cars and such. They do charge for parking in their lot. In San Diego there seems to be a charge and/or tax for simply everything! Since so many people here work for the Department of the Navy, this place could become pretty bad if our economy worsens to the point of layoffs here. But I guess we face that chance anywhere. They do have internet service through AT&T but it is pretty poor as is AT&T in general. I only had one good day/night of decent throughput. Most other times I gave up trying to do anything because of the dropped WiFi signals. I made several official complaints directly to them, not the hotel. The service came back after a couple hours and what AT&T told me were several complaints, but it was down again or spotty at best the next days. Since the hotel is at the end of the island, there isn't as much traffic. It is easy to get across the street to the walk along the bay which goes from the police department and Friendship Bell all the way down past the pier, the beach, and to the Bali Hai Restaurant which has a great Sunday buffet. Shelter Island has a good view of the navel complex with lots of ships coming and going. Since we were there prior to the 9/11 memorial ceremonies, there seemed to be quite a lot of incoming naval ships with some loading ordinance. Some large Coast Guard vessels too. One of the nights we were entertained by the yearly Luau with over 300 people in attendance. The staff was easy to talk to and attentive to our needs which were few. We needed the building with the elevator for my Mother who has limited mobility. The only downside that I can think of was the morning of our departure. They did not have enough staff for breakfast and many people waited a very long time for service and food. We left after half an hour and went elsewhere since our time was limited that day. The grounds are kept clean, the maid service does a good job. There is a laundry at the marina if you need to clean your clothes. Von's supermarket (best one in town) is not far by car. Avoid driving near the airport if you are in a hurry to get someplace as traffic can be very congested. We liked La Jolla so much, that we drove there three times. It is part of San Diego but residents don't like to admit it. There are way more restaurants than you'll have need for so just look at the reviews and pick one in the area you wish to visit. One place that had great food for both breakfast and lunch was called Mission Restaurant in Northpark. As long as you don't eat like a tiny bird this place is for you! Hillcrest, and downtown San Diego are all places to go at night depending on the time from what we were told. Parking is not open to the public but when the hotel is full like during the luau, it is hard to find a parking spot. Parking on the road is forbidden between early morning hours because they water the roadway to make the asphalt healthy L.O.L. (or to wash things out through the sewers and out to sea). The park across the street along the bay is often packed with people who spend the whole day (setting up tents and grilling out) and leave near or after dusk. But the park is kept very clean and there are many places/parks if you include N. Harbor Dr. and Harbor Island Drive Park. all within a few minutes drive.

Reviews.Title: “Could use some help”
Reviews.Author: cookedintucson
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights . Room was not ready until after 4pm . King room not bad but for a resort there was no telephone book , writing paper or pen and pillows we're about 3 inches thick . A $15 a day parking fee is automatically charged to your room if you have a car , I don't know why except to increase the bottom line . I could understand the fee if it was a downtown hotel with limited real estate, but a resort doesn't make sense .

Reviews.Title: “Awful customer service”
Reviews.Author: voyageur_jac
Reviews.Content: 200 paying guests from across the country staying for a week for a wedding. Worst management. When asked if they wanted to please their customers, manager on duty replied "only to an extent". Wouldn't waste your money or precious vacation time. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Kona Kai Resort”
Reviews.Author: Bajadock
Reviews.Content: With the varied reviews of Kona Kai, I approached my recent reservation there with trepidations. Made my reservation through Travelocity's Top Secret Hotels for a 45% discount. The Pop Secret deal is a gimmick that mimics Priceline/Hotwire, but, lets you know the price. Pop Secret gives you the general area, often with too broad of a brush stroke, and several guest ratings of property categories. If you can toggle to/fro the Pop Secret property review and the regular Travelocity review screen, you can get an idea of the candidate hotel. I was able to narrow down my guess to two hotels on Shelter Island, a perfect location for my needs. Within a minute of my placing my reservation for the Secret Hotel, the dramatic news was emailed to me that my winning selection was Kona Kai. What an exciting drama! My stay at Kona Kai was without drama. Just how I like it. My hotel needs are: 1. Location 2. Firm/clean/comfy bed 3. Hot shower 4. Coffee within crawling distance in the morning 5. If staff treats me well, that is a bonus Kona Kai met and exceeded my five needs. I was greeted and treated well. As several have stated, the hallways and other decor is a bit dated, but, I don't care about carpet, wall paper and wall sconces. My room was a clean, 2 queen bed with a desk and a double door armoir for clothing storage. Fast wi-fi internet is free throughout the property. Coffee maker was in the bathroom and for some, this may crowd the smallish 1 sink counter. Also, the bathroom lighting was a tad dim. My room had a nice view of the pool, grass courtyard and marina. Noticed a nice restaurant/bar with bayside and marina views, but, I'm not a fan of most hotel food. There are dozens of good restaurants within 1 mile. Their health club is an excellent facility, even at $15/day. I didn't work out, but, my tour of the club saw dozens of pieces of equipment and all in good condition. A free workout is a walk or run along Shelter Island's waterfront. Kona Kai also has bicycles for rent. Parking is $15 per night. But, the airport shuttle is free and it's a new, clean Toyota mini-van that starts at 05:30 and runs every half hour. Biggest downside of Kona Kai may be the thin walls in the rooms. I noticed some conversation next door when I first moved in. Lucky me, there was no noise at night. Maybe I should add that as a SIXTH hotel room requirement. My overall rating for Kona Kai is THREE out of 5 Hawaiian Leis. This ain't no Hyatt with 10,,000 thread count sheets. But, San Diego is very proud of their hotels with plenty of $200+ properties. At way less than $100, I will return to Kona Kai.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty views .................OUTSIDE your room.”
Reviews.Author: nylori
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews of this property I struggled with whether or not I wanted to stay at the Kona Kai. Since I was attending a wedding at the hotel, I decided for convenience sake to stay. The property itself is very nice. The location is beautiful, the lobby and restaurant and the grounds are great ! The guest rooms, however, leave much to be desired.. My room was in the main building on the first floor. Wallpapered covered hallway walls were outdated and dirty, as was the carpet. The room had a lovely view of the courtyard, pool and harbor and a nice gated patio, however it smelled musty and old. The explanation from the front desk about the smell was to say that it is because they are near the water. I have stayed at many waterfront hotels that have rooms that are not smelly like this one was!!. Anyway, the room itself was small, furnishings old and beat up ( the dresser drawers stuck closed and were difficult to open), carpeting gross, bed linens consisted of very thin sheets and an ugly cheap quality bedspread, and the pillows were flat with no support. The bed was very soft and uncomfortable too. Walls are thin. Bathroom was small, shower and tub could use some reglazing,hinges in bathroom door were rusty, and the towels are more like dish rags rather than bath towels. The staff and the Kona Kai were very nice, however not all seemed very knowledgeable. The rooms at this hotel are in desparate need of renovation !! It's a shame they are so lousy because this could be a really great place !

Reviews.Title: “San Diego - Aloha Style?”
Reviews.Author: tedandmy
Reviews.Content: I was required to attend a conference and meeting at this hotel for work. I used the complimentary shuttle service from the airport. Although the vehicle was rather small for the number of passengers (Toyota Sienna for 8 adults, some of whom were tall, some of whom were portly) we made the short trek without incident. My overall first impression was that this was a fairly nice property. When I approached the front desk the attendant asked what she could do for me. No smile, no warm greetinge; she simply wanted to get to business. It was early in the morning, so I knew there was a good chance my room wouldn't be ready - and it wasn't. She instructed me to come back at a certain time when she would assign my room. I returned at the time she instructed, she said a room was not available and that I should come back in an hour. Once again I followed her instruction. This time when I arrived, she looked at me as though she'd never seen me and asked what I needed. I explained to her that she told me to come back to check in... At this point she said the room still wasn't ready, but she would go ahead and get the paperwork done so that I could come back in an hour and get my key. I agreed, and an hour later I received the key for my guest room. Upon entering my room I found it to be quite dated, with worn furnishings and stained cushions and carpet. The mirrors in the room were obviously not cleaned, evidenced by something smeared on them. When I phoned home, I sat on the bed and happened to look behind the nightstand where there was a dirty tissue from a previous guest, I assume. When I opened the closet I was pleased to find a mini refrigerator; a bit unexpected, but it was a good thing. Clothing is intended for the armoire/dresser. San Diego can be a bit warm, and this place does not offer central air. There is an old fashioned, rather loud, wall-unit air conditioner that protrudes out onto the lanai; which by the way is very nice with its patio table and chairs. The lighting in the bathroom is awful, as is the condition of the tub/shower, with its chips, stains, and mildew. There is a hairdryer and coffee maker, along with plenty of soap, shampoo, and lotion. Somehow my toothbrush didn't make it into my bag. I called the front desk to inquire as to where I could get one after 9:00 p.m. They said they would send one right over to my room. In less than ten minutes there was a knock on my door, and I had a colgate toothbrush and toothpaste. Now that's some good customer service! (I guess it's hit and miss depending upon who is working what shift.) The actual geography around the hotel is great. It's situated right on the water, so the immediate surroundings are lovely. The only way I would return would be for a conference or meeting; unless of course the property underwent a major renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your credit card”
Reviews.Author: OldSrg
Reviews.Content: They had a discounted rate advertised on the website. It didn't matter, they make it up in so many ways. They charge an approx. 11% "Tax Recovery Charge and Service Fee". Parking is $15 a day. If you want to use the gym, that's $10 a day. Oh, and a side of toast in the restaurant is $2.75. My room was reserved to be a pool or garden view. I got the parking lot. Two trays of consumed room service food were in the isle down from my room for two days. The room was decent, the bathroom counter was extremely small, but Wi-Fi is ""free""!!! Expect to spend much, much more than what the room is advertised for. I guess in this economy that's all part of the game.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: Elisabeth R
Reviews.Content: The location can't be topped, and the staff was most accommodating. We arranged for about 20 rooms for family and friends attending a wedding reception downtown. The staff was quick to grant any wish. I had a brunch for 70 people in my suite (coming and going), and they didn't bat an eye. They supplied us with extra tables and chairs and tons of ice. During a blackout they barbecued by flashlight so all the guests could be fed. Overall we had a terrific experience, and all of our family and friends agreed.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: fontainelover
Reviews.Content: We found Kona Kai's website and decided that when we made our trip to San Diego we'd stay there. It was perfect. The service that we received was awesome, some of the best ever. The drivers of the shuttle were very accommodating and friendly. The location is beautiful. The rooms look very much like the pictures. The luau was so fun and if you come down in the summer definitely attend. The restaurant had great food but our service there could have been a little faster. You can take the sidewalk across from the hotel and take a beautiful walk next to the bay. The best thing is since I brought my 4 year old nephew we wanted somewhere safe and this was everything we were hoping for. Great area, friendly service and a wonderful community made this the perfect hotel for us. The trolley that takes you around San Diego picks you up at the front door so there are endless things to do. They were doing constant landscaping and cleaning of the pool and property and that was so nice to see. You are really treated like a customer should be treated here. Would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “a very average hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Clyde_Betts
Reviews.Content: OK, well where to begin. I guess from the beginning. We checked in at about 11pm, on thursday Labor Day weekend. When I arrived there was a much older lady checking in, and was obviously, physically limited, the lady checking her in tried to put her in the old building which had no elevators on an upper floor, the lady checking her in seemed obviously annoyed that the lady said anything, asI checked in I confirmed I had a crib available, and she then tried to put me on an upper floor with no elevator, I explained, baby, stroller, and once again she seemed highly agitated someone made such a request. We got checked in, and went to our room. The rooms are very very aged. I did not have the mildew smell many complain of, but by no means pleasant smelling either. The linens on the beds and the bathrooms, all seem like they have been washed about 10,000 times. extremely thin, extremely worn, and overall very low quality. The housekeeping was ok, but not great. The furniture in the rooms is circa early 1980. very outdated, but not necessarily in bad condition. Just very old. The location is great, at the tip of Shelter Island, we had a great view of the harbor, but our patio furniture was so old and dirty looking you didn't want to sit on it for fear of it rubbing off on your clothes. Some have mentioned the luau, We did not go, but it did create a huge inconvenience as the hotel let all the performers park in our lot. So not only did we have to pay for parking but we had difficulty finding parking because of the luau. quite quite annoying. So here you go: Pros: location is amazing Very pretty property great views Cons: horrible linens cleanliness so so furniture- worn and out dated staff- well just so so parking, ok except for the one day property could use a good thorough cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Dream come true!”
Reviews.Author: EmeraldBird
Reviews.Content: Weekday getaway brought us to Kona Kai. Gorgeous property, beautiful location, impeccable service. Pool & spa are right on the water, steps to a private beach. Check in was fast, friendly and made me feel at home. Looking forward to coming back, I can't imagine choosing a different resort at the same price.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: virys
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. My husband and I had such a wonderful stay. Plus we had the pleasure of meeting the sales direct Kimberly Hubbard. She mention of a luau that they have every Friday and decided to try it out. It was by far one of the most memorable moments in our lives. I want to thank Ms. Kimberly Hubbard for all her help during our stay and the bell man Enrique Sanchez , Every one was so friendly and made our stay one of the best ones.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to hanker down and do nothing for a few days!”
Reviews.Author: missfussbudget
Reviews.Content: Looking for a good, cheap getaway, and found it on Shelter Island, San Diego. Only a few miles from Coronado Island, I might name this the 'poor man's Coronado'. It's a lovely little area with hotels and restaurants galore, more of a laid back atmosphere, a place to settle down and sit by the pool, walk by the bay, catch a seal swimming by. The hotel is really nice and inviting on the outside. In the lobby is a comfy seating area with a nice fireplace, the pool is big and inviting, and I was happy to see they had a few lanes blocked off for serious swimmers. Unfortunately, there were a large group of families and kids staying there and they took over the pool, lanes and all. Who was I to spoil their fun, and yet, I did say I was tryng to swim in one of the lanes....I think during the week, it was probably a lot quieter. The rooms were spacious and simple. They upgraded us to an ocean view with a balcony which was really nice. No fridge in the room, and no extras, and the maid didn't even give me soap and shampoo for second night which kind of irked me, but all in all, it was lovely. If I was to be really particular, I might have told them they need to fix the screen door to the balcony, and provide a few more necessities in the room, like shower cap, and fridge. Hotel has a spa which i did not utilize. The hotel also had a lovely dining room, a Hawaiian Luau if one so desired, a great gym, and free bikes. I booked on one of the discount websites and got a decent price so all in all including breakfast, it was about $348 for two nights and two free breakfasts, and lots of relaxation. Travel easily and even by free shuttle to neighborhood restaurants and concerts.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed in better places in remote villages of Kenya”
Reviews.Author: Kellymath
Reviews.Content: Probably one of the worst experiences of staying in a hotel ever. First, bring some sleeping pills...the walls are so thin that you can't sleep. Second if you ask the front desk a request, it more than likely will not happen (asked to be in a room next to my family a week ahead of time and that did not happen AND asked for my room to get cleaned one day only to come back at 7pm to find it not done)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed..”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel5270
Reviews.Content: In desperate need of renovation! By painting the outside walls & power washing all the concrete corridors would make a huge difference... It looks so sad & tired. In addition money needs to be spent on the pool area, re-surfacing & re-grouting the pool, and creating a bar/cafe area.. The rooms are fine, the location is great, but the restaurant menu & costs need to realistically refelect the clientele.

Reviews.Title: “There are pros and cons but wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: lumeljay1
Reviews.Content: Shelter Island is an excellent location but the rooms at the Kona Kai are very small and the bedding needs to be updated. The price should have meant something a little more elegant. The pool area was nice and kept clean but the chairs are very uncomfortable and you had to go to the front desk for towels. Very rare for a "Resort". The free breakfast was very good with good choices and the best coffee I have had for a long time. The bathroom area was very tiny. We couldn't lay out all our accessories and the toilet was very low. A problem for someone with bad knees. Can't fault the staff though we couldn't check in til after 3:00 p.m. Although we didn't attend the luau we could watch it from our room and it was very cheesy with about 15 mins of happy birthday and happy anniversary to people. Boring! I love San Diego and Shelter Island but the Kona Kai needs to step it up a little. I loved sitting on our lanai though.

Reviews.Title: “A DUMP! The Kona Kai Resort in San Diego is a DUMP!!!”
Reviews.Author: supergirl7777
Reviews.Content: Donâ€™t let the photos of the Kona Kai Resort (cough Motel) in San Diego, CA fool you. This place is an old, filthy, smelly, run down, DUMP! The people who say that this place is great and they love the rooms, would more than likely say the same thing about a Motel 6, Super 8 Motel or a Vagabond. The Kona Kai rooms are on the same level as a 1 star or 0 star motel. Donâ€™t believe the positive reviews, they were either written by the Kona Kai marketing staff, or people who are ok with dirty, roach infested, run down motels. The view of the bay while driving down Shelter Island Drive (across the street from Kona Kai) is beautiful. BUT the first thing we noticed as we entered the Kona Kaiâ€™s parking lot to unpack our car was that the hotel parking lot was filthy. The parking lot, sidewalk and walkways were all covered in what looked like monthâ€™s worth of duck poop, pigeon poop and smashed berries and olives (from the berries and olive trees on the motel grounds). Our room was on the second floor, and we noticed that the stairwell was filthy and covered in more bird poop, pigeon feathers and trash. I was immediately disgusted. The bottoms of our shoes were too dirty to re-enter our car!!! As we entered our 2nd floor room for the first time, we both said WTF as a STRONG musty, moldy smell punched us in our faces and knocked us on our butts. I quickly covered my nose and was like, HELL NO, Iâ€™m not staying here!!! I was ready to check out and find another hotel, but then I realized that it was too late to get a refund. We quickly left the room and drove to the nearest Target to get scented candles, Fabreeze and air fresheners, to spray in the room. Upon returning to the room we quickly took our street shoes off because the bottom of our shoes was covered in bird poop, berries and olives from walking from the car to our room. We put on white socks, which IMMEDIATELY got black on the bottoms from walking on the dirty, ocean air damp stained carpet in the room. We trashed over 12 pairs of socks during our 3 day stay! The two beds looked like an adult jumped on them then rolled around on the beds. The pillows were old, overused and flat. Only one light next to the bed worked in the bedroom area, so the room was dim during the evenings. The balcony, patio table, and chairs were covered in pigeon poop. The closets smelled musty, so we left our clothes in our suitcases the entire time. The bathroom sink area is outside of the actual bedroom and is so small that you can barely sit a toiletry bag on it. The shower towels were old, overused, hard on the skin and some had permanent stains on them. We woke the next morning to be greeted by one cockroach. Then we woke up the following morning to be greeted by 2 more cockroaches in the room. We stayed away from our room as much as possible during our three day stay. We will NEVER stay at the Kona Kai Resort (cough Motel) ever again! The photos look nice on their website and online but this place is an old, smelly zero (0) star dump. If you like filthy hotel grounds and filthy hotel rooms, the Kona Kai Resort in San Diego is for you!

Reviews.Title: “A great location and friendly people”
Reviews.Author: leeshattuck
Reviews.Content: The resort may need a dose of paint on the exterior but this minor detail is counteracted by the location and staff. Some may be irritated by the aircraft and helicopters from the base across the bay but frankly we enjoy seeing America's military might. The breakfasts in a lovely surrounding and the spa, while modest, is staffed by really great people. We love the location and its proximity to Umi's ...THE best Japanese restaurant. We will be making a third visit soon.

Reviews.Title: “Roach Motel”
Reviews.Author: Densonfrnc
Reviews.Content: Looked nice online great location. Checked in rooms were a little dated for the price but what the heck it's near the beach do be it. I am relaxing on the patio and hear my daughter and wife scream. I run in the room just in time to see no less than 15 huge roaches scurry offy pillow. We pack up and go to the front desk to cancell our room and the front desk person acted like it was no big deal no apology nothing. After 3 days of my funds not bring released I called to speak to the general manager and he almost accused ms of lying he said they couldnt find any roaches. I told him to ask the front desk girl about the 2 I brought down in a glass and that I would be happy to send him the pictures I took. Once again no apology nothing and it took 7 days for my funds to be released. These were probably 2 inches long it was very disgusting there was roach feces in my pillow and the way the management handled it was unacceptable

Reviews.Title: “great location , hotel needs updating”
Reviews.Author: dg78041
Reviews.Content: came for the 4th of july weekend with family. Great location but everything seemed shabby and in need of a bit of updating. Everything was extra, the gym $10, bikes $5 each, etc... parking $15 a night very quiet considering the number of people in hotel! good sleep!

Reviews.Title: “ROACHES”
Reviews.Author: 65moms
Reviews.Content: Pre-Deployment visit with our son was really hindered!! Being very far-minded, I would have to say what I liked about the hotel was the view. But you will have to ask yourself if you want to stay at a place with ROACHES and not have the "management" respond to your concern. A report of roaches made to the front desk and ultimately the management yielded no results - unless you consider being shuffled to three different rooms in one night quality managing. My husband actually captured one, killed it, and took it to the front desk. We were not loud about it, but we certainly should have alerted our fellow patrons and I regret not doing so. When we actually spoke to the supervisor the next day, he simply brushed off our concern with the weather and were told, "you should be familiar with these type of roaches." What did he mean by that?? Furthermore, before we returned home we were advised by a well-informed source to remove our items from our luggage and throw out the luggage because any traveling pals could easily have settle in unseen parts of the suitcases. When we reported this to the management (after returning home) we were ignored even after sending two emails. One month later, we were surprised by call from their insurance investigator who said the matter would be checked and we would be compensated. Prior to the phone call we assumed that the management of Kona Kai would at least express their regret for our recent stay - but not a call, email, letter, nothing - no response. And the real surprise (NOT) was to know their insurance company dismissed a claim that we never even filed. Suprise! Nothing! I was glad we did not bring home an infestation and I was quite surprised to hear and learn how much of problem this could have been. We were out three suitcases, some gift items, and a few things that could not be kept. After leaving this place, we never asked for compensation for anything, but a little acknowledgment of our legitimate concern would have been nice. Thanks Kona Kai - you know who we are. By the way USMC families - FIND ANOTHER PLACE to STAY!! You know how busy, last-minute and limited selections can be when you are searching for some place to see your loved one before they leave. In this case it was our son who left in February. Best of luck to ALL USMC famlies!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for families---motel yes, resort no”
Reviews.Author: Boricuadentro
Reviews.Content: Apart from the view, I felt this was similar in quality to a Travelodge/Motel6/BestWestern motel. Good option for families on a budget. It was good value for the price but do not look for any frills or luxury as you might expect at a property labeled 'resort'. Set your expectations accordingly. We stayed for 5days/3nights with two kids under 3, and grandparents and enjoyed sitting on the balcony mornings/evenings watching the boats, helicopters and other water traffic on the bay. Room: Room and linens clean. Good size with balconies with view of bay--nice. Not all rooms have this view so if you want it, ask for it. The pillows were flat wafers and the beds are worn. The bathrooms are very small--squeeze between toilet and vanity to close the door to get into the shower. Each room has a refrigerator. There was no closet door on our closet, the bathroom door was splintering at the bottom from prior water damage, the floor tile was stained, and the bottom of the bathtub needed a thorough, aggressive scrubbing. The towels were clean but very thin. Facilities: Good size sparkling pool and jacuzzi. The pool towels are like kleenex so take your own or get several from the front desk. The play area is just a slide. We did not eat at the hotel or order room service. You will pay $15/night to park a vehicle. There is no elevator so if you want a room with a view you have to climb stairs. Service:The staff was functional but not overly friendly. There is no poolside bar/food service, room service trays were piled up in the downstairs hallway for at least 2 days (they were still there when we checked out---gross). Housekeeping was good but late in the day. A couple of times we returned from a morning out to find the rooms just as we'd left them. It is definitely not a destination resort. If all you need to do there is sleep and shower and you don't need 600-thread count sheets and you don't mind pets or kids, then you should be satisfied with your stay at KonaKai.

Reviews.Title: “My room was large”
Reviews.Author: joegold80
Reviews.Content: I generally try to be positive in my reviews but the title of this review covers most of my positivity (the staff were friendly and the view from across the road out to sea was stunning, but that wasn't even on the hotel property). I was here for three days for a conference, and I can only assume the conference organizers got a good deal, because this place was pretty awful from the moment I walked through the door - especially considering the rate (>$200 a night). Decor was dated from the lobby to the rooms and beyond - to the extent that I felt I was caught somewhere in the early 90s. Room didn't feel clean and the food was poor. Being situated so far from anything in San Diego, it was difficult to get away to eat anything decent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Location & Comfort”
Reviews.Author: NaldoB1
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay! The assistance of Sergio and Jessica and everyone else at this hotel on beautiful Shelter Island in San Diego, CA was EXCEPTIONAL! They knew us by name when we walked in and it had been a few months since our last stay. Clean rooms, comfortable and everyone there had a smile! What a great place, staff and stay! Thanks Sergio & Jessica for making our stay great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice,but didn't live up to its hype”
Reviews.Author: stormcrowe
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nice stay for us,the area is great.you can walk to a lot of places in point loma.try staying in room 126-134(even#) the terrace leads right to the pool. The website made it look like a fun happening place with luaus and hula dancers. When we stayed their was nothing going on.it was like a ghost town.the fees are bad.parking $15 and gym use $10.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis for friends”
Reviews.Author: pkmjtravel
Reviews.Content: I am not sure how hotels stay in business in these difficult times, my guess would be that SERVICE is the difference. From the concierge, to Mike Orantes and Chissie Esguerra at the front desk, our family stay here was very good...thank you for giving us a great deal, and also taking good care of us in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: mommyofcharlie
Reviews.Content: Loved the resort! The staff was so accommodating! Chrissie at the front desk was wonderful and Emilio was so very helpful!!!! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant layover”
Reviews.Author: dflom
Reviews.Content: Having a flight canceled because of mechanical difficulties, and not being able to get out until the next day, is not fun. But being put up in this hotel by the airline was as fun as possible. The location is on the end of Shelter Island, convenient to all things in San Diego, and with a park that runs the length of the island. You have the choice of bay or marina views, a beautiful pool area, and even a small beach. The staff was great, especially Enrique, the driver, who helped my wife find her lost eyeglasses. All in all, a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the location on Shelter Island”
Reviews.Author: kbman0222
Reviews.Content: What we enjoyed most about this hotel was its location and the price for an ocean view room with balcony is one of the best around. The rooms are clean, but outdated. We went with a AAA discount and the parking was free. This is another plus for a San Diego hotel. We also received free vouchers for breakfasts, but only went once as the food was not very good at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the location”
Reviews.Author: bhydephoto
Reviews.Content: We were a little concerned after reading some of the reviews, but the price was right and it was a good location for San Diego sightseeing so we went there. Yes, the hotel is older and not glitzy, but we found the facility clean and comfortable. The decor is set up to give an island feeling. The bathroom was small, but had a nice counter and worked fine for us. The bed was comfy although the pillows were a little flat. However, for the price we paid it was a real bargain, especially since you had San Diego Bay right outside the hotel. My recommendation: if you want the posh setting and marble bathroom, go to the Hyatt or the Marriott and pay three times more. If you want a comfortable hotel that's convenient to everything and has a laid-back feel, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: MrLeisure812
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Kona Kai on Many occasions. My most recent stay as well as my previous stays were very pleasant. I have recommended this Resort to my Friends & Family & they all told me how they enjoyed thier stay and how it was very pretty and relaxing. The Staff is to be commemded on the good Job they do. Ms. Beverly Boyd always goes out of her way to make my stay a rewarding one. Thank you Ms. Boyd & your Staff J.Spain

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place, Fantastic Service!”
Reviews.Author: jandlman
Reviews.Content: When we arrived Sergio at the front desk was very courteous and helpful. When I asked which side of the hotel we would be facing he told us we were facing the parking lot, but that we could upgrade to the marina side and that it was complimentary. He also gave us a rundown of all the great amenities at the property. He told us about the pool, the marina, restaurant, bar, and the spa services. I told him I was very impressed and he comped us a breakfast at the restaurant. We got to the room and were pleasantly surprised. The room was beautiful! What a view! Roomy, cozy, nicely decorated and very comfortable. Then, we got to know the area a little. We ate the hotel's restaurant, had a drink at the bar, took a stroll down the marina walkway and the length of Shelter Island and really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and friendly place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: luvsandiego
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at this property , the staff was very courteous and friendly and the property was very nice. The hotel could be updated but the rooms were clean.The grounds were lush and had great views of the marina on one side and bay on the other. A park is across the street for leisurely walks and picnics.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort ambiance for very reasonable rate”
Reviews.Author: travelller2
Reviews.Content: Overnight trip for some employment interviews in San Diego and WOW what a nice resort. Great location on shelter island, marina and small beach on one side, bay on the other, nice pool area with 25 yd lap pool and jacuzzi, nice lobby, free local restaurant shuttle. Amazing value for the triple A rate with free Internet and parking. Jessica and Evan were extremely helpful with restaurant suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “I think that Jessica was awesome!! She booked our rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: carski13
Reviews.Content: I have not stayed at the hotel yet, we are arriving on June 13th, but I found dealing with the hotel reservation person "Jessica" to be so pleasant! She made me more excited to stay at the hotel and I also got our friends to book an additional 4 rooms. I hope that this review some how gets word back to her. She was so professional, listened to my concerns, was willing to find answers to any of my questions. Lovely person! See you soon!!

Reviews.Title: “The front desk lady Patrice was excellent....very friendly”
Reviews.Author: laylay1
Reviews.Content: Very Nice room....Best experience I have had in a long time.... The front desk was very friendly and inviting. I think the girls name was Patrice. being so close to the ocean was great...

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: ricnanc
Reviews.Content: I am helping to plan a wedding in San Diego this September. Our wedding party will be making reservations at the Kona Kai Resort and we went to the resort to see if they could help us with some information regarding the accommodations. My friends and I were fortunate to meet the Front Office Manager, Michael Orantes. Michael went out of his way, patiently explaining and offering suggestions to us regarding the rooms and the property. He was so helpful that we went ahead and made several reservations right then. We will be referring others to this hotel and naming Michael as the "go to" person.

Reviews.Title: “Want to be treated like a family friend?”
Reviews.Author: VernonSailor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I as well as another couple stayed at the Kona Kai for 10 days this April and we were charmed. From Mike and Michelle at the front desk to Enrique, James and Milo on the shuttle, everyone treated us wonderfully. While the itself hotel was a pleasant surprise, the staff were also able to give us travel, dining and sightseeing tips that helped make our stay especially wonderful. Clean rooms, great facilities and excellent value!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, great staff, and priced right.”
Reviews.Author: JayATC
Reviews.Content: We haven't stayed here before, but will definitely stay here again. Everything was clean and well maintained, the staff was excellent and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Seachange91362
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. Nice staff, attractive rooms, very clean, beautiful location. Nice proximity to harbor, downtown, Balboa Park and zoo. All are within about 10 minutes by car. All the amenties in rooms (coffee maker, iron, hair dryer, mini fridge, great wifi). If people in adjacent rooms are loud talkers or door slammers, it could make it hard to sleep, but I find this to be the case in many hotels. Otherwise, I love this hotel, and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has a great location and very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: jrende747
Reviews.Content: I am an airline pilot. I usually stay at the Kona Kai with my girlfriend the night before I have a trip. We love the location, relaxing atmosphere, and the great service given to us by Jessica Avelar. She always greets us by name, has a great smile, and is very professional. We could stay anywhere, but Jessica always makes us feel at home. We stay there 3-5 times a month. Thanks Jessica!

Reviews.Title: “A great little resort right at the marina!”
Reviews.Author: sailor0805
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a really nice room with huge bathroom and beautiful decor. Great views of the marina and a jillion dollars worth of gorgeous yachts!

Reviews.Title: “Run down”
Reviews.Author: Biztravel-CO
Reviews.Content: Its tired. Needed to stay near our business in Old town San Diego. Did priceline for $145 and ended up here. Yes, good views of the water. But hotel reminds me an old motel 6 or best western. Pictures make it look exotic. Its not. Better off staying at the large chain hotels near airport. Gaslamp is much nicer too- stayed for around $100. I used to work in El Cajon (south of Downtown and a bit inland) A Best western of same caliber would have been about $60

Reviews.Title: “HUGE disappointment - will never stay again!”
Reviews.Author: AllegroChicago
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old and shabby. My mother, sister and I were excited to stay at the onset of a one-week vacation. We arrive shortly after 9:30 pm on a friday eve and were disappointed to learn that the restaurant was already closed and that it was too late for room service. After a sleepy drive to the nearest restaurant (McDonald's), we returned to the hotel. In the dark, it was very difficult to discern which building was ours as it was very poorly marked. Upon opening the door, we found a dark and dingy room waiting for us; it smelled so musty that my asthma immediately kicked in. We inquired whether or not another room may be less musty and the woman at the desk gave us a key so that we could check another room. It did smell better but unfortunately it was just as shabby as the first. It was late and after a full day of flying we were really tired and decided to stay. Due to a loud party in the room next to ours, we got little sleep. We shared our concerns with the hotel staff and were met with modest response. In all, the furnishings were old and run down, the flooring was in poor condition, the bathroom fixtures were broken and the beds and bedding were deplorable. This hotel needs a complete overhaul and the customer service is sorely lacking.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME CUSTOMER SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: RonB0712
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel frequently and each and every time we stay here we are lucky enough to have Jessica help us! She is such a cheerful and helpful person who goes out of her way to make you feel like royalty! The Kona Kai is ALWAYS clean and comfortable. We used to stay at at Hyatt however we much prefer this hotel as the staff & especially Jessica are more helpful & courteous all the way around! Thank you Jessica & Kona Kai San Diego for such great service and plan to visit again & again!

Reviews.Title: “stay in room #359 -- very nice view of the bay, very clean room”
Reviews.Author: mavis-too
Reviews.Content: we had the pleasure of staying at the kona kai for a meeting in november of the american board of dental radiologists. our room was clean, but in need of renovation. alas, the bedspread and other fabric items were worn-out and tired. with that stated-- the person cleaning our room did an amazing job. the sheets, and towels and supplies for everyday were clean and crisp. we also noticed how hard everyone worked to make our stay most comfortable. whether it was the shuttle driver, the front desk person, a waiter, etc. etc. everyone pitched in to make it work. thank you for all your kind attention staff and employees of this property.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent view, lovely area, great conceirge”
Reviews.Author: ljjh
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel in a great area. The price was competative with other hotels in settings not as nice. I would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Resort with all amenities”
Reviews.Author: mnyvent
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to stay for 5 days in this hotel. It was comfortable and clean with an accommodating staff. The location is outstanding. it has a fantastic view of the San Diego Bay and there is a Marina on the other side with a view of Point Loma. We enjoyed walks along the Bay and the use of the excellent work out spa. We were so pleased that we booked another four days in December over Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location But Property Needs a Facelift”
Reviews.Author: morris3445
Reviews.Content: The short summary is this: The Kona Kai is in a beautiful location on Shelter Island. The views of the bay are quite nice. The pool area and patios, facing the marina are also pleasant.Â  The lobby is quaint with an invitingÂ  fireplace. The dining room with its great big windows looks over the marina.Â  Too bad that the food is inedible.Â  Too bad that the rooms are run down and worn and the walls are paper thin.Â  Too bad that there was NO heat in our room on a cold December night and too bad about the cockroaches scurrying across our hotel room. Too bad that we paid for a water view which we did not get and when we asked for a refund of the difference between the water view and the non view, the reservation manager refused to compensate us.Â  Speaking of the front desk staff,Â  they provided theÂ  worst customer service I have EVER experienced in any hotel I have ever stayed in. The general manager, on the other hand, was quite helpful and appropriate, however he was off premises so our problems did not get resolved until day three of our visit. I honestly do not know how this hotel stays in business.Â  It has seen better days and theyÂ  need to gut the place and start over.Â  The location is so pretty that a renovated property with a new set of front desk staff could probably do quite well here. We stayed here for a convention. Had it not been for the convention and the fact that they charge an early departure fee, we would have checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: JohnfromJersey2002
Reviews.Content: This place sucks. great location, but this place is a dump. Rooms are in desperate need of renovation. Smells musty. Food during conference was mediocre. Phone didn't work,q but they did fix it. There are a million other places to stay. Avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad, needs improvement.”
Reviews.Author: Partymonster99
Reviews.Content: I came to San Diego for a quick getaway before all the holiday madness began. I checked in with a young lady who seemed confused and seemed like she didn't know what she was doing. It took at least 20 minutes for her to locate my reservation once she found someone to help. After waiting 20 minutes, I was told the room was not ready. She asked me to have a seat until the room was ready. I waited almost 40 minutes in the lobby watching people come in and out getting room keys and not be acknowledged. Had I known it was going to take over an hour I would have left to enjoy the city since it was a nice Sunday afternoon. I asked if my room was ready and she looked aggravated that I was asking. I then asked to speak to a manager and she went somewhere in the back and came out and said the manager was in a meeting and not available. When I asked her to have the manager come speak to me after her meeting she said "if she's still here, I'll have her come out." I continued to watch her give keys to other people and even watched a shift change in agents. Finally, I could not handle the frustration, I attempted to see the front desk again. I asked her again and she told me it would be 45 minutes. Im not one to complain but after seeing so many other people get rooms I had to say something. She apologized and said to have a seat and she would help me in a bit. 25 minutes later, I saw the young lady run off with her belongings to leave. I tried to remain patient after being so upset, when the new agent who arrived Crissy, saw me waiting. She asked if I was waiting on a room and I explained my situation about waiting and how the manager was surprisingly unavailable. Instead of waiting the 45 minutes, Crissy immediately found a room for me and even offered a full view room at no additional charge. She was very pleasant and friendly and a complete turnaround from the gal before her. Crissy had suggested a few things to do while in town and even had great suggestions on some sales for shopping. After speaking with her, I was really excited to go about my day and had forgotten about the negative experience I had first encountered. Later that night I encountered another issue when trying to order room service. I was unable to reach room service as the phone just kept ringing. Another 45 minutes later and numerous attempts to call, I went downstairs to the restaurant and saw no one there to help me order. I waited 10-15 minutes and saw not even one worker so I decided to go back to the front desk to see if I can find help. At the front desk I saw Crissy helping a line of people and she was the only one helping. This hotel must be short on staff because with a line like that, I would assume one would be highly overwhelmed. Apparently, after eavesdropping, I gathered their flight or plans were cancelled. I thought my day was bad until I heard some of these peoples horror stories of not having a decent meal since 7am! Watching people venting frustrations and upset people taking out on her, Crissy maintained a polite and positive attitude. Finally, her back up came and they managed to check everyone in within 10 minutes. When she finally noticed me standing there she asked me if I was ok and I explained my issue regarding room service. She and Patrice seemed apologetic and they took my order and walked it over to the kitchen. They said it should be half an hour and my food came in less than half an hour qt that point. Thank you Crissy and Patrice! The grounds seem like it has alot of potential, surrounded by water with amazing views, however, it seems dated and can use some renovation. The hotel has a Hawaiian theme however the buildings (according to the hotel map) are named after Mexican cities. Cabo, and cozumel, cancun? Doesn't make sense. The furniture in the lobby and in the rooms seem old fashioned and I don't understand why or how it fit the hotel motif if it even had one. The bed was an older bed and felt like it had to be 20 years old. The hotel definately needs some updating and renovation, once that is done I'm sure the hotel would be a great resort. Also, if the staff is more trained and anything like Crissy and Patrice, I would come back because they seemed very sweet and helpful. Until then, if i were in the area, I would probably go to another one of the 4 hotels in the area. I just hope someday the Kona Kai does decide to remodel because the land around is do beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Kona Kai”
Reviews.Author: desertriver99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Kona Kai 3 nights with two teenagers and pet. Location on Shelter island is quiet with great views of habor and city, 10 min. proximity to Ocean beach and downtown. Good AAA rate included free parking. This was the first time we travelled with pet, extra $70 for entire stay. We usually don't book rooms that allow pets due to allergies and our pickiness about cleanliness , but our room at Kona was clean. Internet was fast, had a fantastic 1st floor harbor view of the yachts. We stayed at the adjacent Best Western property last year, but the AAA rate at Kona was much better- glad we chose it. The Best Western is newly remodeled though, so given identical rates, I would pick the Best Western (and it has tennis courts). Fun trip, thanks Kona Kai !

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location but sadly in need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn028
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a prime location with easy access to all the major areas in the city but still on the water in a secluded quiet spot. It could be wonderful but.....our room had old furniture and the bedskirt had a large hole in it. The security door lock needed a new battery in it. When we arrived we could not get in thru the door they told us to go to. We had to drive out the locked gate and around to the front of the complex. They then helped us with our luggage. For the rest of our 5 day stay the door was propped open which gave access to anybody to enter. At the same time, they had locks on the inside doors to the ice machine, so if you forgot your key you got locked inside an area surrounded by hotel. When making the reservation, I was told breakfast was included in our rate up to $36. per day and that it would be taken off our bill at the end. They also stated that parking was included. When checking in they gave us coupons for breakfast.. We found the restaurant used special menus for the coupon people with a very limited number of items, only five items. I ended up eating the same thing every day as most of the menu was made up of high calorie fattening items. I'd say check if they have renovated yet as they told us they were going to do that soon and find out the room rate without food. Some complained about the parking. We had no problems with the gate, but parking is quite a ways away from your room, so be prepared to walk.

Reviews.Title: “worst place I have ever stayed in USA”
Reviews.Author: JAYasanke
Reviews.Content: I have been a business traveller for 10 years in US. This the worst place I have ever stayed in the in he entire united states. They charge you for using the gym, charge you for have asking for extra chairs in the room. The worst costumer service I have ever had entire entire united state. Unless you are a sucker for the topography I woiuld recommed this place to my worst enemy

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view with terrible room”
Reviews.Author: sarihui
Reviews.Content: The room carpet was not clean. When I walked , made the furniture that bad quality shaking and noise. The place for basin, with coffee maker and to charge your mobile phone was too small. But it has beautiful view. For the breakfast , they serve in some menu. You should pay for the juice and toast. But the food was nice. Don't miss the Belgium waffle. They will offer you what juice you want to and then give you the menu which show the price for juice. The swimming pool is attractive. The front desk staff forgot to smile. :( . I am dust allergy.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: Otis4
Reviews.Content: Hotel definately needs a face lift! Carpets and paint are shabby. Bathroom tub is stained. Beds are hard. Shower head only trickles water. The phone in the room didn't work. I reported the last two items to the front desk - but no one ever came to fix them. $15 a day parking is steep! Peaceful and beautiful location.

Reviews.Title: “Nader Family loves the Kona Kai, San Diego”
Reviews.Author: coco048
Reviews.Content: My Family and I have been coming to the Kona Kai Hotel for many years for a family reunion. The Hotel employees do not treat us as just guests they treat us like family. We lost our mother last year and postponed that trip to this year and when I arrived at the hotel Amber, Adriana and Peggy all came out of the office to hug me and tell me how sorry they were about the loss of my Mother. What Hotel can you go to and feel the love I did at the Kona Kai. They handled all of our food events so professionaly, let us pick out the movie for the Saturday night movie on the lawn and the Luau on Friday was top notch. Forget that the hotel is right on the bay with beautiful views, We'll be going back because of the beautiful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great anniversary Trip to Kona Kai”
Reviews.Author: ginaduyen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to celebrate our anniversary in San Diego and we chose the Kona Kai resort because we heard great thing about the location. We really love the hotel, we had a room with patio looking out to the bay with fabulous view. The room was a little small but but was clean and very comfortable, the Staff was very attentive. We had a great Luau celebration on Friday 9/3/10 with my niece and her boyfriend (they also stayed at the hotel). Our booking came with breakfast so we ate breakfast the restaurant, which has great view of the marina. Overall we like the Kona Kai hotel alot and will come back. I think the hotel should be a four star instead of 3. Gina

Reviews.Title: “What a relaxing experience!”
Reviews.Author: SkipJacovino
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to stay at the Kona Kai Resort over the Labor Day weekend with our 7 year old daughter. We had made plans to watch the Hawaiian Luau show that Kona Kai runs on Fridays in the summer and then stay the balance of the weekend. First off, checking in and parking were a breeze and very efficient. When I entered the lobby to check in, the first thing I noticed was the warm Spanish Villa styled lobby area. The huge fireplace, cushy chairs and couches, and warm tones immediately put me in a good mood. We were greeted by the manager Dennis Vinegas who assured us that our stay would be memorable (and he was right). Our bellman, then helped us to our room and took care of our baggage...he was so fast that he actually beat us to our room (I still don;t know how he did it!). When we got to our room, we noticed that we had a great view of the main courtyard and pool, as well as the marina (and a nice balcony to take it all in)...what a specatacular view. After settling in , we saw the Luau/Hula show which was fantastic...the food was delcious, in particular the Kahlua Pork and the Lomi Lomi Salmon..I have to admit I went back for seconds and thirds! The show was very nice, with children and adult perfomers and even two fire dancers...The next day,(Saturday) we awoke and had breakfast in the main dining room. Again, it was a very comforting place, with it's vaulted turret ceiling and beautiful views of the Shelter Island Marina...and the food was plentiful and freshly prepared..and most importantly, served efficiently and courteously. The wait and bus staff was qucik to cater to our every need. Later, we went to hang out at the pool and jacuzzi and spent the bulk of the day just lounging and relaxing. The hotel has a pool cocktail/food server and we definitely took advantage of their services. The Calamari and the Mojitos are a must-try.by the pool. We had dinner offsite that night (another story which is not so nice...I won't mention the place). But we made it back in time for a nice evening soak in the jacuzzi and for our daughter to play on the playground adjacent to the pool before heading to bed. Thewre were other families in that area with a fire going in the firepit on site which gave the evening a real "clambake" celebratory feel...a very nice night.
