My little boy wasn't so sure about that, but he'll come around. Anyhow, it was a pleasant experience, and we'll probably book it again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Deweybeach
Reviews.Content: We had one bad experience after another from the moment we walked in to our room. There were crumbs all over the carpet and both queen beds looked as if they were made but someone had rolled all over them. Even better, the bed spread was drapped over two thin pillows standing on head of the bed. My 4 year old could make a bed better than that! The room had a bad smell..... Room was incredibly small. I went to wash my hands and the while drying them, the towel rack just came right out of the wall???!!! Wanted to take a shower and within seconds the tub filled up and realized that the water was not draining at all. Called housekeeping and they sent someone right away that started drilling and snaking the tub. So mud all over the floor, lots of noise and 40 min later, still not fixed. Asked for another room. We were given one. So my husband attempted to go to the bathroom but there were toilet paper and stuff in the toilet already!!!!!!. Tried to flush it and water started running off the back of the tank. Just terrible experience. Not impressed by anything at all. DO NOT STAY HERE. You can spend the same amount of money and stay at much much better/cleaner and more up to date places in SanDiego. Believe me, I have always had pleasant experiences anywhere else in SanDiego.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to relax and enjoy the elements”
Reviews.Author: grny
Reviews.Content: our expericane at the kona kai was very nice. the restaurant was excellent. the views were awesome. we didnt rent a car, we walked and took advantage of public transportation. this place is close to airport, downtown, and old town by way of bus. 2.25 urban fare. the resort wasnt real helpful with information regarding things to do in the area. the driver though(free shuttle) was most helpful . the room was somewhat outdated, carpet worn, but what can you expect near water. it wasnt as bad as some of the other reviews suggested. its a very relaxing place, so it would have been nice to have coffee mugs in the room rather than paper cups. you could bring your own good coffee to enjoy at your leisure. we found in general the folks we ran accross in san diego just really lacked that friendly smile. people are much more friendly in the bay area. we would definely return though. we had a wonderful stay and dont have any complaints that would stop us from returning. plenty of things to do on shelter island if you just want to be leisurly. plenty of restaurants and places to party if you dont want to leave the island. i'm a real stickler about cleanliness, and i was comfortable here. they will be renovating later this year, cant wait till it is complete to return.

Reviews.Title: “This is a nice place!”
Reviews.Author: ervbo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from 4 days at the Kona Kai. It is a very nice place and we enjoyed our time there. We would definitely go back. Here are the pros and cons of our experience: Pros- very good value. They had a spring break special of $159/nt. Great pool with a lap lane (I am a swimmer). Great views on both sides (harbor and bay)- you cant lose on view with a room on either side. Very peaceful and restful during the day. Very nice room and balcony. Free internet that I could get, even on the beach (bay side). Nice jacuzzi. Good food at restaurant. We did not notice any carpet problems or mildew smell as a previous reviewer. Free shuttle was nice and they will drop you off and pick you up anywhere between the hotel and the airport. We did not rent a car. We enjoyed renting bikes and riding them down to the gaslamp area. Wonderful! They only charge $5 for 2 hours and even gave us a little extra time :) Great place to jog along the bay or on one day I ran north up to the top of tjhe hill and the Pt Loma bible college. Plenty of free parking ont he street. Lille kids playground on their beach. Cons- Noisy at times at night. The walls do seem a bit thin but mostly when my neighbors ran water, it was very loud in my room and would wake me up. It was a Pro for me but could be a Con for you that the hotel is at the end of the isalnd and sort of removed from everything. Easily solved by renting a bike or car, though. One day the maid forgot to make up our room. :( The staff was fine but not overly friendly. Shuttle driver gave us good advice on places to eat. I really liked the touch of Venice restaurant down the way. Water taxi only ran between 3-9. Better to ride bike to the real water taxi by the russian sub- it goes all day and is super cheap. Our objectives were to rest, spend a lot of the time at the pool ride our bikes along the bay, not need a car and eat pretty well. Our objectives were certainly met :)

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here when it was Shelter Pointe Hotel ... it was "okay"”
Reviews.Author: jetlagnow
Reviews.Content: After having stayed at just about all of the hotels on Shelter Island (and unless this one has been recently upgraded)... I would rate it dead last. It doesn't have the charm or character of the Best Western or Humphries. The parking lot is tedious. My room had outdated decor, ugly color scheme and the architecture is fairly hideous. The location is great on Shelter Island, but that is about the only good thing. It was just... "adequate" which for the price you expect a better experience. The bed was okay comfortable. The screen was broken on the sliding glass doors and the screen material was peeling into the room. Just felt a bit ripped off for the price. The lobby was full of people milling about for various weddings in the neighborhood -- kind of annoying atmosphere. The vibe wasn't really quaint or tropical or laid back like Best Western (which had free fresh chocolate cookies on their front desk) or Humphries (which had snotty desk people but a nice tropical feeling & flow to the property). Kona Kai is sort of lame and uptight. Can't describe it really. The "view" from the rooms is obstructed partially. Just an okay experience. Would rate it a C+. I prefer the Best Western down the street and even Humphries for about the same price range. It's better than staying in a motel-8, but for the money, you expect more. I haven't tried the one called the Bay Inn (I think?) but one lady in the parking lot told me that she liked it and that they had a free brunch, which none of the other Shelter Island hotels offer (to my knowledge). So I would try that or Best Western, then Humphries.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Splendid”
Reviews.Author: teawithtiff
Reviews.Content: Kona Kai is neslted at the tip of shelter island...secluded, intimate, private and romantic. We had a FABULOUS front deskman, Danny! He upgraded our room on the house and provided excellent service the entire time. The staff was VERY attentive, going out of their way to show me where vending machines and dining halls were. The pool/spa area is like the backyard of a well groomed home, except overlooking the ocean! The room was Very nice folks. I don't know about these other reviewers...but apprently, they didn't have THIS room. It was large, kitchenette, spa tub, bedroom/living room area...two t.v.'s, and a balcony stretching from the living room to the bedroom...it was monstrous. And best of all, the balcony, as with everything else in this hotel, overlooked the come hither ocean. The hotel is surrounding by tall trees and a row of neighboring hotels...but not too close together...just the right amount of space. Parking's $15 bucks...BUT, you can park on the street, right outside of the hotel for FREE! And if you get there late enough, or during an off season, they'll just let ya' park in the check-in parking lot. It was NO biggy. The place is PERFECT for what it's for. Now, if you're looking for the Venetian, obviously...this ain't it...but it isn't intended to be! One note: The on-grounds restaurant serves break, lunch, dinner a la carte...yikes! So, just go down to one of the several restaurants in the area instead...and don't pass up the noteworthy italian place around the corner. HAPPY HOTELING! -THE HOTEL CONNAISSEUR

Reviews.Title: “Good location - less than friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: OHi0Traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, situated on Shelter Island. One side of the hotel faces San Diego Bay while the other side faces the Marina. The hotel is expansive and it is difficult to navigate from one end of the hotel to the other since it is made up of different buildings. My room had a private patio facing the Bay, and was comfortable although wireless internet was virtually non-existent in the building in which my room was located. I also requested, and was assured that I would receive, a morning wake up call, which I did not receive. Another person in my party also did not receive his wake up call. They do run a shuttle between the hotel and airport, but reserve space early as it is only a van that can only hold 5 people, including the driver, with luggage. The shuttle driver was much more friendly than the front desk staff and took the time to ask how our visit had been and what could be improved upon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice views, rooms a bit small.”
Reviews.Author: CMCNJ
Reviews.Content: Every room in this hotel has a lovely view of the Harbor and/or marinas, the pool is great as is the hot tub. Great location for people who want to relax and take walks. The restaurant was adequate. Staff was friendly and helpful but often too busy to help quickly. A room with two queen beds had only 3 very small drawers and one small closet. The bathroom was large, but mostly floor space -- tub and toilet in a large room. The sink and vanity outside was tiny, barely room for the coffee pot on one side and a small basket with washcloths on the other -- barely any room for toiletries. Hotel provides shuttle service to airport and will take you to other locations if someone is available to do so, but the drivers sub as bell personsso are often busy. Some tour buses and trolleys will pick up there, but if a taxi is needed, it's about $25 to downtown, Oldtown or Seaport Village. Not sure I'd stay there again, since it's not a great resort hotel and too far from sightseeing locations if you don't have a car. (Parking costs $15 per day) Would rather try one of the other hotels on the islnad that had equally great views.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful location”
Reviews.Author: jstruck33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights following a cruise to the Mexican Riviera. Our room was in a great location, high floor with a balcony overlooking the harbor. The room was average but clean and comfortable. The hotel was quiet and the food at AJ's restaurant was very good. The only down side is that we didn't rent a car and had to walk or take taxis everywhere. The front desk staff was very nice and helpful. The lobby is beautiful. I would stay here again but only for a few days, not an entire week or more.

Reviews.Title: “Last time staying here”
Reviews.Author: Angel O
Reviews.Content: I unfortunately made the mistake of booking a whole week here. Upon arrival, the guy at the front desk was training a person on the computer and made us wait over 8 minutes before we were helped. Then I found out I had to pay for daily parking which was too much. Then the room I was given was terrible because it was right next to an exit door. Every time it was closed, it made a loud bang and it kept me up late and woke me up early. There was no other room available so I had to put up with it. Also, this hotel doesn't have a nice pool if that's one thing that you're looking for. The only plus about the property is its location. It has a nice view of the harbor. I truly would not recommend this hotel. It is not work the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Spot”
Reviews.Author: spacoli
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a wedding. Location was good. Rooms were pretty nice but a little small. Pool was great. Harbor/marina views are great. Our room had a nice balcony and harbor view. Restaurant was good for breakfast. Free shuttle to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “It was Great!”
Reviews.Author: MelbaGirl
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel mainly because it looked like it would be less hectic than the other Shelter Island Hotels. I was worried after some of those reviews that I made a bad decision, I even had other hotels staked out incase. I did not have to worry. This was the perfect spot for what I was looking for. Though there was a mustiness to the hotel room, it did not smell BAD, opening the sliding glass wiindow onto the patio took care of that. The bathroom was small and yes a little worn, but it was clean. The pool was great but if you want some quiet, don't go on a weekend, too many teens and children. The room service was excellent, we ordered dinner twice and breakfast - it took 20 to 30 minutes just like they said and everything was hot. Their restaurant was very nice inside and out, I especially liked it outside as it overlooked the bay and felt private. Their bar was nice but it seems they only take your orders at poolside on Saturdays. However, a little cooler with drinks is perfect, the ice machine is close enough. We had initially booked the Marina View, that wasn't ready at time of check-in and received a room in the 210-217 portion above the lobby. This was great it was the closest to the Bay, laying on the bed we could see the water and a little patch of green. We had a great time sitting out on the porch watching everyone walking with their dogs and enjoying themselves. I looked around and a lot of the ocean views had too much parking lot as part of it. I recommend this part of the building highly. Because this hotel is at the end, it gets less car traffic. I spent a lot of time walking around the bay and marina - it is pretty enough that if you choose not to go anywhere you still get to be out of the hotel grounds and enjoy the scenery. I never once thought this place was noisy, I'm not sure if the people by the doors and ice machines felt the same way, so you may ask and be sure you are not in a traffic path. I was looking for a quiet and laid back place with no frills but clean, this was it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: WestMItraveller
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about this hotel after reading some of the very negative reviews, but our stay at Shelter Pointe exceeded my expectations. The location of the hotel is perfect, it is a 10 minute drive to anywhere in San Diego. The rooms were clean and nice, a little humid, but very nice. It is true that it isn't extremely quiet in the hotel, but we didn't hear any conversations or get woken up early in the morning. You can just hear kids outside by the pool and doors slamming in the other rooms, but it is not too bad. The hotel grounds are so beautiful, it is located in a great spot. Basically any room you have would be very nice. We reserved the cheaper room and were on the first floor with a patio out to the pool courtyard, and this was great. The pool and beach are very nice, it seems like a great place to take a family. It is annoying that parking is an extra $15 a day and they don't warn you about this, but it is really nice to park just outside the door of your building and not have to hastle with street parking or anything like that. We never ate at the hotel restaurant, but there is plenty of good dining nearby. Downtown is only 10 minutes away, and you can find anything you would want there. We ate at Miguel's Mexcian restaurant one night, it is on the corner of Scott St. & Shelter Island Drive, it was good and inexpensive. So if you have a reservation here, don't cancel it just because of those negative reviews. I was very impressed with the hotel and the grounds, and there is so much to do in San Diego that you'll never be in your room anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden charges”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: They are one of those hotels with annoying hidden charges. If you want to park your car in the hotel lot, it's $15 per day. No where in the booking process is this charge indicated. The only other parking is in the street with the beach going public.... Good luck. I'm very much against these charges that are only revealed to you at the check in desk. The rooms were OK for a maximum of 2 people and the location was great. Recommended eating spot is Point Loma Seafood about 2 miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a stay at the Shelter Pointe--now under new management and known as the Kona Kai Resort. We had a wonderful stay. The room was clean with updated modern bedding and furnishings---sort of a subtle island resort theme. The beds were double sheeted--a nice touch, because who likes to touch hotel blankets?! We never heard any noise from adjacent rooms. The resort is situated in a beautiful location--Shelter Island. Both sides have views of yachting marinas. The pool area was beautiful---a good sized pool and hot tub, tons of nice cushy lounge chairs, etc...all with a view of the marina. I didn't have much interaction with the hotel staff, but the housekeeping was always thorough and timely. The location is also good...the island feels intimate, but you are very close to Point Loma and about a ten minute drive from downtown, the Gaslamp Quarter, Old Town, etc. Overall, I highly recommend this for couples and for families---a nice little playground on the premises and another just a short walk down the island.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: mikeyjgross
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a quick vacation swing through San Diego. The room was great, the staff was friendly and very helpful, and my wife and I both feel this is the most exquisuite location we've ever stayed at. The view of the marina from our room was just spectacular, and the pool and jacuzzi were wonderful. MY wife and I can't wait to plan another trip to this wonderful resort -- it is the highlight of our trip!

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE READ! Do NOT waste your $$ here!!”
Reviews.Author: Steelnation
Reviews.Content: What can I say, the stay was extremely disappointing from the minute we arrived, the worst hotel experience I have had in 30 years. First off they had us arriving in March, we reserved for February. Because of their mistake we were put in a bay view room with queen beds, we reserved a harbor view room with a king. The gentleman at the front desk offered to lower our rate for the trouble, yet he lowered it to the regular rate of the room we ended up in. Room service meal was awful, over priced drinks at the bar (AJ's). They charged the wrong credit card and finally - this is the loudest hotel I have ever stayed in in my life (I have traveled internationally for years). The walls are PAPER THIN and you can hear everything. We could hear people's full conversations in other rooms, heard hairdryers at 6 in the morning, could hear if some blew there nose for crying out loud. Save your money and take heed to this and the other negative reviews, as they are the TRUTH.

HotelInfo.Name: Kona Kai Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 1551 Shelter Island Dr, San Diego, CA 92106
